GET.desc: This help page
Gets a JSON description of the FPP Commands
Returns the E1.31 or DDP statistics for inbound packets. Attempts to return a meaningful error if connection to FPPD fails.
Returns the current configuration of any output processors.

POST.desc: Overwrites the output Processor settings file with a new configuration and returns back the file after the save

GET.desc: Returns the current configuration of the specified output in JSON format
GET.output: JSON output varies based on file.

POST.desc: Overwrites the specified output configuration file with the specified JSON

GET.desc: Runs the given command with arguments separated by a slash /

POST.desc: Runs the given command with arguments provided in POST data instead of URL
POST.input: (JSON data dependent on command being run)

GET.desc: Get list of config files in /home/fpp/media/config(/:SubDir)
Get contents of config file /home/fpp/media/config(/:SubDir)/:FileName

POST.desc: Upload contents of config file /home/fpp/media/config(/:SubDir)/:FileName
Configure outbound email using existing settings
Send test email using existing settings

GET.desc: Get list of files in :DirName where :DirName is one of ('config', 'effects', 'events', 'images', 'logs', 'music', 'playlists', 'plugins', 'scripts', 'sequences', 'tmp', 'uploads', 'videos'). If ?nameOnly=1 is supplied then the array will only contain filenames
Downloads all files in the specified directory in zip format. (Currently only supported where DirName == Logs)
Moves the specified file from the uploads directory to the correct subfolder returning a status of "OK" or an Error message if not successful

POST.desc: Copies the specified file from :source to :dest where :DirName is one of ('config', 'effects', 'events', 'images', 'logs', 'music', 'playlists', 'plugins', 'scripts', 'sequences', 'tmp', 'upload', 'videos').

Renames the specified file from :source to :dest where :DirName is one of ('config', 'effects', 'events', 'images', 'logs', 'music', 'playlists', 'plugins', 'scripts', 'sequences', 'tmp', 'upload', 'videos').

GET.desc: Downloads the specified File where :DirName is one of ('config', 'effects', 'events', 'images', 'logs', 'music', 'playlists', 'plugins', 'scripts', 'sequences', 'tmp', 'upload', 'videos'). If ?tail=# is supplied then only the specified number of lines from the end of the file are returned. ?play=1 then will set the content type to be played rather than downloaded.

DELETE.desc: Deletes the specified file where :DirName is one of ('config', 'effects', 'events', 'images', 'logs', 'music', 'playlists', 'plugins', 'scripts', 'sequences', 'tmp', 'upload', 'videos'). If ?nameOnly=1 is supplied then the array will only contain filenames

GET.desc: Gets the current e131/DDP/ArtNet input statistics
Gets the current output volume
Gets the current log for each log instance
REturns status about Multisync instances
Gets the list of known FPP instances
Returns a projection of Playlists and other events that are scheduled to start in the near future.
Gets the current status of the FPPD daemon
Gets the current test mode configuration
Gets the current FPP version
Gets the current output volume
Returns a a list of the commits that are in the Origin (usually Github) but not the local repository.

rows.msg: Use our SaveJsonToString() when generating MQTT warnings JSON message.
Move Playlist initialization into main() via Player::Init()

GET.desc: Returns lists of fppos files available locally or on Github for the current platform
Performs a hard rest on the current branch, removing any local changes

log: HEAD is now at a1b65d43 Git Reset moved - #944
HEAD is now at ebc3abe Fix typo, missing space.

HEAD is now at 307d46f Support Raspberry Pi 4

GET.desc: Returns the status of the local git branch including any dirty files. (Same as 'git status')

output.log:
On branch master
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/master'.

GET.desc: Get list of media files (includes both music and video files).
Get duration of a media item
Get meta data for a specific media file

streams.codec_long_name: H.264 / AVC / MPEG-4 AVC / MPEG-4 part 10

GET.desc: Gets info on all of the Pixel Overlay Models

POST.desc: Uploads a new model-overlays.json file

GET.desc: Gets a single Pixel Overlay Model
Gets a list of fonts that can be used on the overlay models
Gets a list of the Pixel Overlay Models and their state
Gets the given overlay model and it's state
Clears the given model
Gets the current channel data for the model
Gets the current channel data for the model encoded in RLE format.  RLE data is in quads in the format count,a,b,c[,count,a,b,c]... where a,b,c are the 3 data channels for a pixel.

PUT.desc: Sets the state of the overlay model
Fills the entire overlay with the given color
Sets a specific pixel in the model to the given color
Displays text on the overlay model

GET.desc: returns information DNS configuration. If not configured, status will be 'Not Configured'
Returns detailed information about the network interfaces and their IP addresses as well as wifi strength
Retrieves the current network interface configuration

POST.desc: Updates the saved configuration but does not restart the network.
Applies the networking settings for the specified interface at the OS level and restarts the interface.
Creates the Interface Persistent names.

GET.desc: Returns information about wifi networks that can be discovered via the specified interface. (NOTE: It is possible a network without a SSID will be in the list.)
DEPRECATED:Use network/wifi/strength
Returns detailed information about wireless network interfaces and their signal strength
Get list of playlist names

POST.desc: Insert a new playlist

GET.desc: Get list of playlist names and sequences that are playable
Returns a list of Playlist and any validation errors that are present
Immediately stop the currently running playlist
Gracefully stop the currently running playlist
Gracefully stop the currently running playlist after completion of the current loop
Pause the currently running playlist
Resume a previously paused playlist
Get Playlist named :PlaylistName in FPP JSON format. If ?mergeSubs=1 is specified, then any sub playlist will be recursively merged into the parent playlist.

POST.desc: Update/Insert the Playlist named :PlaylistName.

GET.desc: Start the playlist named :PlaylistName.

POST.desc: Insert an item into the :SectionName section of the playlist :PlaylistName

GET.desc: Get list of installed plugins

POST.desc: Install a new plugin.  The data passed in is a pluginInfo JSON structure with branch and sha values added to the top level to indicate which branch and sha to install.

GET.desc: Get pluginInfo.json for installed plugin PluginRepoName.  An additional 'updatesAvailable' field is added to indicate whether the plugin has any updates available that have been fetched but not merged.
Returns the value of a given setting from the Plugin specified as :RepoName

POST.desc: Sets the Speciffied Setting for the plugin identified by RepoName and returns that same setting value
Check plugin PluginRepoName for available updates.  this works by running a 'git fetch' in the plugin directory and checking for any non-merged updates.
Pull in git updates for plugin PluginRepoName

GET.desc: Returns the list of IP addresses that this FPP instance can proxy
Get the contents of a remote URL at http://:IP/:PATH
Return a list of currently installed scripts
Install a remote script from the script repository
View the source code of a remote script
GET.output: The content of the script as a string

GET.desc: View the source code of an already installed script
GET.output: The content of the script as a string

POST.desc: Takes the body of the POST requests and writes it to the file specified by :scriptName

GET.desc: Run a locally installed Script
GET.output: The output of the script as a String

GET.desc: Get a list of all FSEQ files
If the sequence was paused by sequence/current/togglePause, then will step the sequence forward one frame
If the sequence was paused by sequence/current/togglePause, then will step the sequence backward one frame
Stops the current playing sequence. Only valid if sequence started by /api/sequence/:SequenceName/start/:startSecond
Pauses or Resumes the current playing sequence. Only valid if sequence started by /api/sequence/:SequenceName/start/:startSecond
Get the FSEQ file for the named sequence

POST.desc: Upload a new FSEQ file

GET.desc: Get metadata from the FSEQ file for the named sequence

Starts the given sequence at the specified time frame. Only intended for testing. In most situations, it is best to use "Start Playlist" from the command API and pass the sequence name as the playlist name.
Get JSON list of settings
Get info about a for a particular setting include the value.

output.name: AudioFormat
output.tip: The Audio Format generated by the decoder

PUT.desc: Sets the value for a specific setting

GET.desc: Get array of options for a particular setting.  This is currently only valid for options requiring a list of valid items and only for some of those which are used in the settings and playlist User Interfaces.
Returns the statics file that will be shared with the development team if sharing statistics is enabled.  Generally a cached file is returned, but if ?force=1 is sent then it will be regenerated.

POST.desc: Transmists the statics to the remote server

GET.desc: Restarts the fppd process. Can also pass ?quick=1 to reload some configuration without full restart
Starts the fppd process (if it isn't already running)
Stops the fppd process if it is running
Results in reboot of the operating system
Execute a clean shutdown of the Linux operating system.

Gives a fppd, network, current playlist, schedule, utilization, host, version, and mqtt information.  Can also pass an optional array of ip addresses like &ip[]=192.168.0.1&ip[]=192.168.0.2 to get information on a remote.
Returns the Current volume if FPPD is running or the Volume Setting if not

POST.desc: Sets the volume.  The volume should be passed as a JSON message.

GET.desc: Returns information about the current state of the Test Mode for this instance

POST.desc: Sets the current Testing model on this instance
